virtual void sxsdk::image_interface::get_z ( int  x,
int  y,
float &  z,
void *  aux = 0 
) [virtual]

Gets the Z value of the specified pixel.

Only images rendered with the Keep Z checkbox checked in the Rendering Settings will have a Z value. However, regardless of this setting the Z value can be accesssed during rendering, so the effector plugin uses the Z value.

Parameters:
x the X coordinate
y the Y coordinate
z the Z value

Gets the Z value of the specified area.

Only images rendered with the Keep Z checkbox checked in the Rendering Settings will have a Z value. However, regardless of this setting the Z value can be accesssed during rendering, so the effector plugin uses the Z value.

Parameters:

z the Z array
virtual bool sxsdk::image_interface::has_real_color ( void *  = 0  )  const [virtual]

edit makeheader.py Whether the image has real color or not.

Returns true if the image was saved with a color depth of 64 bits in the Rendering Settings or if the image was loaded from an HDRI image format.

virtual bool sxsdk::image_interface::has_z ( void *  = 0  )  const [virtual]

edit makeheader.py Whether the image has the Z values or not.

Only images rendered with the Keep Z checkbox checked in the Rendering Settings will have a Z value. However, regardless of this setting the Z value can be accesssed during rendering, so the effector plugin uses the Z value.

virtual void sxsdk::image_interface::set_real_color ( int  x,
int  y,
const sxsdk::rgb_class &  real_color,
void *  aux = 0 
) [virtual]

Sets the color of the specified pixel.

The alpha channel is set to 1.0 (opaque). Use set_pixel_rgba_float() if you include the alpha channel.

Shade 7 and earlier had both 32 bit (8 bits per channel) and 128 bit (32 bits per channel) real color images, but Shade 8 has combined these into one image format. Therefore, set_pixel() and set_real_color() work together.

Parameters:
x the X coordinate
y the Y coordinate
real_color the color (32 bits/channel RGB HDR)
virtual void sxsdk::image_interface::set_real_colors ( int  x,
int  y,
int  dx,
int  dy,
const sxsdk::rgb_class *  real_color,
void *  aux = 0 
) [virtual]

Gets the color of the specified pixel. (32 bits/channel RGB HDR).

The alpha channel is set to 1.0 (opaque). Use set_pixel_rgba_float() if you include the alpha channel.

Shade 7 and earlier had both 32 bit (8 bits per channel) and 128 bit (32 bits per channel) real color images, but Shade 8 has combined these into one image format. Therefore, set_pixel() and set_real_color() work together.

Parameters:
x the X coordinate
y the Y coordinate
dx the X size
dy the Y size
real_color the color array (32 bits/channel RGB HDR)
